snippet: Weeklong summer camps at Peabody Museum give children as young as first graders a chance to explore fields like archaeology, astronomy and paleontology.
abstract: Dinosaur Detectives, summer camp for second and third graders offered by Yale Peabody Museum in New Haven, has become so popular that registration fills up within days of opening in February; giving campers tours through some normally off-limits collections at Peabody, Dinosaur Detectives is one of dozen week-long summer camps offered by museum (Metropolitan/Connecticut).
lead_paragraph: Weeklong summer camps at Peabody Museum give children as young as first graders a chance to explore fields like archaeology, astronomy and paleontology.

headline.print_headline: How Yale’s Youngest Can Be Dinosaur Detectives
headline.main: How Yale’s Youngest Can Be Dinosaur Detectives
